en.cv: Tailane - Fullstack Developer - UIUX Designer - Simples - English.pdf
en.about-description-tailane:
Since childhood, I've been self-taught, exploring different software on my own and naturally discovering my affinity for design, programming and games. Curiosity turned into practice, and practice became a passion for creating digital solutions that combine aesthetics and functionality.

My journey hasn't been simple. I grew up in a rural area with limited resources, but that never stopped me from seeking knowledge. I earned a spot at a federal university in the Information Systems program, where I made it through to my final year. I plan to resume and complete my degree next year, further consolidating my education, though I have already pursued others along the way.

I continue to grow with dedication in design and technology, creating useful and well-crafted digital experiences. This portfolio was entirely developed by me, from designing each page in Figma to the final implementation with HTML, CSS and JavaScript, built on solid foundations, the well-done basics, reinforcing my commitment to consistent development on the path to becoming a senior Full Stack developer.
en.about-description-certifications:
Information Systems Bachelor's Degree (UFF, completion soon)

Technical in Administration (1200h, in progress - management, logistics)

Technical in Marketing (800h, completed - consumer behavior, branding, digital media)

Database Administration (IFRS, in progress - SQL/NoSQL, performance)

Python for NLP (ICM - text processing, automation)

Web Systems Project (IFRS, 30h - requirements, UML)

Swift Programming (Hackatruck - OOP, APIs)

Systems Automation (IFRS, 30h - Automation and Project; Robotics and Industry; Machines and Networks).
en.about-description-experience:
Freelancer Full Stack & Designer (2025-current - web development, social media design)

Business Development Manager - Desconto Urbano (2024 - expansion strategies, market analysis)

IT Intern - Municipal Education Department of Saquarema (2022-2023 - event support, IT problem resolution, system manuals, user training)

Database Analyst - UNIMED Hospital (2020 - Oracle databases, PL/SQL, query optimization)

"How I Met Robin" Project (under construction - collaboration with programmers and communities from Reddit and How I Met Your Mother fans; creation of original artwork, design, narrative and digital development in team.
en.about-description-hobbies:
Night cycling with the Ciclistas Sem Fronteiras group, exploring the city while trying not to fall off the bike

Book club with programmers and IT professionals, discussing technical books and innovation

Blog *Gluten No More*, where I share my journey with Hashimoto, learnings about health and exercises for body and mind

Painting, sculpture and photography, plus digital drawing, I've participated in competitions and love experimenting with new techniques to see how far my creativity goes

I often play games and love strategic or cooperative challenges, if you want to play with me just call

On Saturdays, bike rides to the beach, my moment to recharge energy and keep body and mind in balance.
en.about-description-blog:
Gluten No More is a blog I created 3 years ago to share my journey with Hashimoto.

I've lived with this autoimmune condition since I was 12, which was an exception, as it's not common for it to appear so early. That's why I developed an intense focus on maintaining balanced mental and physical health, reconciling with my unrestricted interest in technology.

The idea of transforming my personal blog into a community was born in 2025. Initially it was very intimate, but now I'm completely reformulating it to soon launch a community platform about stories, overcoming and healthy living with Hashimoto. I want the platform to help other people find balance and inspiration, just as it helped me share my experiences.

I intend to use my Full Stack development and design skills to create an intuitive and welcoming digital experience, integrating content and interaction in a way that technology enhances the community, always developing on the path towards my Full Stack goal.
en.project1-description: Personal portfolio developed with a 100% original and responsive design, focused on programming and design.
en.project2-description: Interactive periodic table with detailed information on each element.
en.project3-description: Landing page for travelers and outdoor camping enthusiasts to explore natural beauties.
en.project4-description: Website for selling tickets and providing information about a gaming event.
en.project5-description: Corporate website for inspection services, focused on performance and SEO.
en.skills-default-text: Click on one of the skills to see more details about my journey with this technology.
en.skill-desc-figma: I have been using Figma for over 5 years, initially in a self-taught manner and later through a certified course. It is currently my main tool for creating website layouts. The entire design of my portfolio was previously developed in Figma, which allows me to better structure projects, reduce rework, and make more accurate visual decisions. I intend to use it as a standard tool in all future web design projects.
en.skill-desc-github: I have been using Git and GitHub since 2019, throughout my degree and in personal projects. I hold a certified course and use the platform in virtually all of my programming projects, both for version control and for organizing the development workflow. I am familiar with branches, pull requests, commit history, and versioning best practices in both individual and collaborative environments.
en.skill-desc-html: I have been using HTML since childhood, with my first contact at the age of 8, when I was already manipulating page structures to remove unwanted elements. Over the years, I deepened my knowledge through books and formal studies, focusing on best practices, semantics, and code quality. I have extensive familiarity with modern HTML and maintain constant attention to accessibility, structural organization, and markup readability.
en.skill-desc-css: I formally learned CSS in college and deepened my knowledge through courses and continuous study. I am familiar with modern layouts, responsiveness, and style organization, including the use of Flexbox and Grid. I also have experience with Sass, which I have used in previous projects, although less frequently today. I stay up to date with language improvements and apply best practices focused on UI and UX.
en.skill-desc-java: I had my first contact with Java during the second semester of college, around 2020. Since then, I have used the language intermittently over the years and maintain a strong interest in the technology. Currently, I am deepening my studies through advanced courses, such as those from Dev Dojo, as well as reading classic Java books. I use Java in personal projects and always choose the technology according to the project’s needs.
en.skill-desc-sql: One of my greatest interests in the IT field. I learned it in college, from modeling (1st, 2nd, and 3rd normal forms) to implementation. I spent hours exploring Beekeeper and worked as a Database Intern at Unimed, an experience that reinforced my passion for data modeling and administration. I still aim to deepen my knowledge much further, possibly even pursuing a DBA path in the future.
en.skill-desc-php: I have been using PHP since approximately 2021–2022, with my first contact during college, especially in the study of Object-Oriented Programming. I developed an ERP system using PHP as the main technology, applying OOP concepts and best practices whenever possible. I am comfortable with the language and confidently use it in web projects that benefit from its approach.
en.skill-desc-javascript: I have been using JavaScript since 2019, with strong presence in academic and personal projects. A large portion of my portfolio uses pure HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, especially in web projects focused on controlling logic and interface behavior. I have solid familiarity with the language and, in more recent projects, I have been gradually migrating to TypeScript.
en.skill-desc-react: I have been working with React since approximately 2022. I have completed courses in the technology and used both React and React Native in academic and personal projects. I participated in a hackathon during college, where I worked with React Native and API consumption. I use React thoughtfully, applying the technology only when it makes sense for the project’s goals.
en.skill-desc-python: I have been using Python since the beginning of college, around 2019–2020. I am very comfortable with the language and have used it extensively in academic projects, problem-solving, small games, mathematical applications, and scripts. I also have experience with regular expressions (regex). It is a language I feel comfortable with, especially in academic and utility contexts.
en.skill-desc-django: I have been working with Django for about 5 years and use the framework according to the project’s requirements. I usually choose Django when organization, productivity, and database integration are needed. I have developed projects using the technology and am familiar with its ecosystem and development workflow for web applications.
en.skill-desc-typescript: I have been using TypeScript for several years and have been increasingly deepening its use in recent projects. The language has become an important part of my workflow, as it facilitates code organization, predictability, and maintenance of more complex JavaScript projects. I hold a specific course and apply TypeScript mainly in web and back-end projects, focusing on structure and code quality.
en.skill-desc-illustrator: I have been using Adobe Illustrator for over 5 years, with predominantly self-taught learning. The tool is mainly used for creating logos and refined vector artwork, both in personal projects and occasional freelance work. I am highly familiar with the environment and vectorization processes.
en.skill-desc-node: I have been familiar with Node.js for several years and have been using it more intensively in recent personal projects. The technology is mainly used for building flexible and agile back-end applications, combined with Express and databases, and is a frequent choice when projects require speed and service integration.
en.skill-desc-photoshop: I have been using Adobe Photoshop for approximately 17 years, with a high level of familiarity and fluency. I have worked with image editing and processing, website layouts, graphic materials, and various visual compositions. It is a tool that has been part of my skill set for many years, allowing me to execute tasks quickly, safely, and independently. Some of the work developed with Photoshop can be viewed later in the portfolio.
en.skill-desc-affinity: I actively use Affinity in my current workflow, with fast adaptation and a high level of familiarity. The tool is mainly used for creating icons and vector graphic elements, including the icons and decorative elements of my own portfolio, all fully original. I have also used Affinity for logo creation, making it a practical and efficient tool in my design process.
en.skill-desc-krita: I have been using Krita for about 5 years, mainly as a tool for study and creative development. It is an environment I use to practice drawing, improve motor coordination, apply visual theories, and experiment artistically. Using Krita directly contributes to the development of soft skills such as creativity, visual perception, and artistic repertoire, which reflect in my design work as a whole.
en.skill-desc-canva: I have been using Canva for approximately 7 years, with extensive familiarity with the tool. It is mainly used for creating flyers, document covers, and institutional graphic materials. In a professional context, such as at the Municipal Department of Education, I used Canva regularly for visual production, contributing graphic materials beyond formal IT responsibilities.
en.skill-desc-indesign: I have around 2 years of experience with Adobe InDesign, including formal training through a course. I mainly use the tool for layout design, typography, and visual organization of materials such as ebooks, booklets, and longer documents. I am familiar with editorial workflows and the construction of layouts focused on readability and visual hierarchy.
en.contact-intro: Let's talk about technology, design and innovation? I'm always open to new projects and connections!

en.recommender-rosana-role: Director of Statistics and Educational System Management in Saquarema
en.recommender-rosana-download: Download recommendation letter from Rosana Gildo Vieira
en.recommender-rosana-quote: “(...) her technical competence, commitment, and interpersonal skills make her an exceptional professional, capable of facing challenges with efficiency and excellence.”
en.recommender-flavio-role: Public Education Policy Advisor in Saquarema

en.recommender-flavio-quote: “I am confident that she will continue to achieve great accomplishments in her career and will significantly contribute to any organization that has the opportunity to have her on their team.”
en.footer-rights: Created by Ariana de Abreu. 2025. All rights reserved.
en.project1-description-detailed: Personal portfolio developed entirely from scratch, from design conception to final implementation. The project features a modern architecture with intuitive navigation across the following sections: Header, Home, About Me, Projects, Technical Skills, Contact, and Recommendations. The website is fully responsive with three breakpoints (mobile, tablet, desktop), including a hamburger menu for mobile and an adaptive layout across all sections.
en.project2-description-detailed: This project was one of the first I developed in college and it marked my learning process with HTML and CSS Grid. I created an interactive periodic table where each element works as a button that, when clicked, reveals a window displaying the symbol, the name, a brief description, and four images showing where the element can be found or how it is used in everyday life. It was a fun and challenging exercise that helped me better understand layout organization and make the content more engaging and accessible.
en.project3-description-detailed: A web page for travelers and wild camping enthusiasts, focused on conveying the beauty and serenity of exploring nature. The site provides visual guides on locations, essential gear, and tips for facing challenges, promoting the philosophy of traveling alone but well-prepared. The development prioritized a visually striking design and smooth navigation.
en.project4-description-detailed: A simple website for a gaming and technology event featuring ticket sales, venue GPS location, and a mini photo gallery of the event. It includes a main page, guest information, schedule, and an integrated checkout system. Developed with Next.js for improved SEO and performance. This project was created to complete the challenge proposed by #CodeMeninas.
en.project5-description-detailed: Corporate website highlighting inspection services, project gallery, and professional portfolio. The goal was to create a clean, professional, and high-performance digital presence, making it easier for potential clients to get in touch. Developed with Astro for maximum performance and SEO, integrating a visual gallery system and a functional contact form.
